stanza.line: How like a winter hath my absence been
From thee the pleasure of the fleetingyear
What freezings have I felt what dark days seen
And yet this time removed was summertime
The teeming autumn big with richincrease
Bearing the wanton burden of theprime
Like widowed wombs after their lordsdecease
Yet this abundant issue seemed tome
But hope of orphans and unfatheredfruit
For summer and his pleasures wait onthee
And thou away the very birds aremute
Or if they sing tis with so dull acheer
That leaves look pale dreading the winternear
